description: Also use grey_opacity=False by default, this makes it easier to composite renderings

![xrb_3d_w30.72m_plt100933_radvel_annotated.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BXbAb/images/790892837-xrb_3d_w30.72m_plt100933_radvel_annotated.png)

pullrequest.title: Fix issues with opaque sources fading volume renderings. Closes #1129. Closes #1202. Closes #1194.

content.raw: maybe it's too much alpha?  I had to us 0.05
content.html: maybe it's too much alpha? I had to us 0.05

pullrequest.title: Fix issues with opaque sources fading volume renderings. Closes #1129. Closes #1202. Closes #1194.

content.raw: Yes, I found you need to play with alpha a bit to get a pleasing rendering. Also the lines don't use any antialiasing so you may need to go to relatively high resolution to get unbroken lines.
content.html: Yes, I found you need to play with alpha a bit to get a pleasing rendering. Also the lines don't use any antialiasing so you may need to go to relatively high resolution to get unbroken lines.

pullrequest.title: Fix issues with opaque sources fading volume renderings. Closes #1129. Closes #1202. Closes #1194.

content.raw: ok.  I'll play with alpha more.  But at 1920x1080 resolution -- that's pretty high (HD for movies), so I hope you don't need to go much higher than that.
content.html: ok. I'll play with alpha more. But at 1920x1080 resolution -- that's pretty high (HD for movies), so I hope you don't need to go much higher than that.

pullrequest.title: Fix issues with opaque sources fading volume renderings. Closes #1129. Closes #1202. Closes #1194.

content.raw:
Ah, that's actually higher than I've tested, so maybe try lower resolutions too?

Also keep in mind that the annotated version is going through pylab, which may be messing with it.
content.html:
Ah, that's actually higher than I've tested, so maybe try lower resolutions too?

Also keep in mind that the annotated version is going through pylab, which may be messing with it.

indeed, it is save_annotated creating the problem.  I look at that, and perhaps implementing a line thickness.

I might know what the issue is for save_annotated though...
content.html:
indeed, it is save_annotated creating the problem. I look at that, and perhaps implementing a line thickness.
